availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James William Finnie (Union County, Kentucky, farmer, judge, soldier, and politician. )

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and politician. Kentucky native. Father of Sarah Attaway Finnie and Eliza Finnie. Trustee of Caseyville, Union County, Kentucky, in 1839. Farmer in Union County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. County judge in Union County in 1851. Town commissioner in Caseyville, Union County, in 1858. Resident of Union County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Union County in 1860. Served in the United States Army as a captain and assistant provost marshal for Kentucky's 1st Congressional District from 1863 to July 1865. Police judge of Caseyville, Union County, in 1865. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Union County in 1865.
